Honey Bees pollinate
the alfalfa and hay
that the cows eat.
Without them dairy would
be rare and expensive.

We'll have eggs.
Free range chickens eat
insects, greens, and
whatever they scratch up.

Milk comes from cows.
Dairies rely on the
alfalfa crop pollinated by
Honey Bees to feed them.

55% of sugar in the US
comes from sugar beets
which are
-you guessed it-
pollinated by Honey Bees.

Strawberries are pollinated
by Honey Bees and
other bees. So scratch
that from your cone!

Vanilla is pollinated by
a human hand.

Enjoy your slightly sweet,
very expensive
vanilla flavored eggs!

Are you sure
you want to quit?
